p: We apply bootstrapping to estimate the 68% confidence of the emergent linear relationship due to the small sample size of the CMIP5 ensemble. First, we randomly resample the data with replacement, where the size of the resample is equal to the size of the original sample N. Second, we compute the least-squares linear best fit for the resampled data. Third, we repeat this procedure m times (minimum m = 100) until the difference between the median best fit line of m − 1 and m computed regressions approaches zero (the actual threshold was set to a difference less than 1%). We derive the 68% confidence contours of equal probability based on the set of m random regression lines.
